thread.title: Mitchell may join Tigers this season
thread.title_full: Mitchell may join Tigers this season

author: Jason Smith
title: Mitchell may join Tigers this season
text:
The University of Memphis appears close to adding former Texas A&M commitment and Miami (Florida) Southridge High combo guard Raquan Mitchell for the upcoming season.
Mitchell (6-foot-3, 175), a three-star 2015 prospect who committed to Texas A&M in early August, wrote on Twitter on Saturday afternoon that he now plans to enroll at Memphis.
“I will be going to the University of Memphis,” tweeted Mitchell, who included a photo of himself wearing a black No. 23 Memphis jersey.
I will be going to the university of Memphis #tigers #Memphis pic.twitter.com/dpQZK3EDuk
— Raquan tmc Mitchell (@twothree_quan) October 10, 2015
Mitchell, who couldn’t be reached for comment Saturday, averaged 22 points and five rebounds as a senior at Southridge. He had been part of a five-man 2015 Texas A&M recruiting class ranked No. 8 nationally by Scout.com.
Although it’s unclear why Mitchell chose not to follow through on his commitment to the Aggies, Memphis does have room for Mitchell on this year’s roster. The Tigers have an open scholarship with coach Josh Pastner having said this week he didn’t expect senior forward Chris Hawkins to return this season. Hawkins missed the second half of last season with a knee injury and was not cleared medically to play this year.
Memphis already has a plethora of combo guards, including three freshmen — Jeremiah Martin, Randall Broddie and Craig Randall. The addition of Mitchell would give the Tigers more insurance in the backcourt with senior point guard Kedren Johnson potentially facing season-ending shoulder surgery, but it won’t help the Tigers’ lack of depth inside.
Pastner couldn’t be reached for comment Saturday.
